intro: Fagara polyacantha, commonly known as the many-thorned fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a berry-like structure that contains several seeds, and it is often found in shaded understory environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
